Q_DESC: A polygon is regular if its sides are all the same length and the angles between all of the adjacent sides are equal. The area of a regular polygon can be computed using the following formula, where s is the length of a side and n is the number of sides:  area=n*(s*s) / 4*tan(pi/n)Write a program that reads s and n from the user and then displays the area of a regular polygon constructed from these values.
